column5: Great to hear that your Dad is doing so well and that you made it home safe!   Welcome back and Merry Christmas!  blyght  PS pat the dog for me
Hey Glen,  Glad all went well.  My Dad went through the same thing and is still around to see his 7 month old grand child.  He still needs you.
Glad to hear it all worked out well.  Hope he keeps recovering quickly.
Good to hear 'bout your Dad Glen, ya cant keep those fiesty old Guy's down for long. Once he's healed up,he'll be in better shape than you
Glad to hear he's doing good, my old man only (57) just had a quituple bypass, the works, it's been 5 months and he's feeling better than ever.
Welcome back - and glad to hear your dad is on the mend. Hope you get some time at Christmas to go back and spend some time with him.    Don

Sounds like things went well Glen. I'm sure he's a tough stubborn bugger like you..so I can't drill it home to you enough to be sure he isn't in a situation of needing to lift anything PERIOD for months!  My mother had her quad at 65 and is now into her 81st year as of May. My sister had a quad at 50..3 years ago now and even though she says she didn't...I know she was carrying around her new Granddaughter before she should have been. Now she has a sternum that is a jelly mass instead of bone structure/muscle and is permanently disabled and had to resign as head floor nurse.  I repeat...make sure he's in a position where he doesn't have to lift anything and he'll have many wonderful years ahead of him.  Wayne
Glad to hear your Dad is on the mend.  Welcome Back.
Glad to hear thing went well for your Dad, hope he has a speedy recovery...

Hi Glen, sorry to hear about your dad, and your pup. I have been out of sorts for over a week myslelf(chest cold, and probably a touch of the flu). Don't remember much since last saturday. Probably was in chat, but don't remember. Glad your dad is doing ok. My dad had quad bypass also way back in 1995, and he got through it fine. Recovered well within a year, and was back out walking a few kilometers within 2 yrs. Hope your dad does also, and hope the pup recovers as well.
Glen glad to hear your dad is doing good, I know I am slow .

Glad to hear everything is looking up. My mom had her first heart attack last Christmas. Thankfully,she only needed a stint and is doing fine now (it was still really scarey). It was a real eye opener and it changed the way I live my life. I quit smoking and even though I'm eating better I've put on a few pounds (part and parcel. I think).  I started doing the outdoors thing,camping and fishing etc. It made me put things in perspective and see what really is important. Kind of sucks at Christmas,but just think, you've already got the best present you can get. Hope the next couple weeks is a little calmer for you. Sounds like a good reason to take it easy and go fishing.  . Take care.

Seems like open heart surgery is relatively routine any more with a very high sucess rate.  I know of many people in the age range that had multiple bypasses, valve replacements, and all were succussful.  My grandmother was in her mid 80's when she had it done and recovered wonderfully.   Great news to hear your father came through this and improving each day.  Just make sure he follows the Dr. instructions and don't rush the recovery process ... it will come
Goo to hear all is going well, makes the holidays that much better.
Glen, My father in law had the same operation in August and was discharged 5 days later. Right now he is in Texas in his motor home for the winter and never felt better.
Glad to hear the positive update, hope you and your family have a great holiday...  Mike
Dang you had the old dawg and the young dawg on the mend now. Glad to hear 2 good reports give a holler if you need anything bud.  Art
Nice to hear your dad is getting better!  welcome back GCD!
Wow G, I'm glad it all worked out.  I know how stressful that can be.  Great to hear he's coming around, and nowadays, those open heart surgeries are almost routine it seems.  Keep us updated.  Joey
GCD, glad to hear your dad made it thru the surgery and is doing well.  Hope the road to recovery is a speedy one for him.
WOW!!! Sorry to hear about your dad, but happy to hear it all went very well!!! Home on Monday...amazing what they can do these days.  Looks like you got your Christmas present early this year

Wow Glen !!!  So glad to hear your dad got thru the operation ok and is on the mend...  Marveous what they can do nowadays in the medical fields...  Big news for diabetics from the Hospital for Sick Kids in Toronto today...

Great to hear Dad's gonna be OK Glen, that makes for a nice Christmas present for everybody involved  !!  I've known a few folks who've had the same operation and every single one was 100 % better after they got back on their feet again. They say it's just like getting a tune-up on your car and your good for another 100,000 miles

Dam dawg I was really starting to worry about ya, this explains a lot bud. I am very glad to hear your dad's on the mend. Man you've been thru a lot the last couple of weeks. Hope you are all done with the heavy stuff so you can enjoy the holidays!  Take Care  Phil
That is great news to read GCD!
Great news for you,Glen now you can relax a bit.Have yourself a great holiday season take care .  Steve
Glad to hear everything looking good. Make sure he gets lots of rest and with the repairs soon he'll feel better then ever.
Great news GCD,here's hoping everything works out just fine......Chuck and Shelley......
Great news GCD!  Now as long as the dog mends as well you'll be having a great Christmas.  Keep us posted buddy.
Great to hear, Glenner....
Great news to hear!
Thanks, Glen.  Best to you and Ol' Yeller.
great news!  Glad to hear is is doing ok!  Cheers!
glad all is well  my dad had the same story just over a month ago
Good to hear your Dads doing well!
Great news GCD and Welcome Back Buddy!!!!!

76 doing very well it's taking him a while to convince himself that he's ok...he's been afraid to do things even though his doctors say he can do pretty much what he wants to do and with the heart meds he is on, he has less chance of have a heart attack. then a 40 year old person

Wow...pretty tough eh Glen?  Glad Dad is pulling through.  buddy at work had a former co-worker go down on the job two days ago with a major coronary.  guy had about 14 hours of surgery in the last 36 hours but is now apparently speaking again and they think he may recover.  Gotta love medicine, and those wonderful, patient doctors and nurses!
Good to here everything went well with your dad Glen.......
Great to hear that your Dad is on the mend GCD! Welcome back!
